servers.title: Manage Nameservers
servers.sshKeyInfoText: Bind configuration files are distributed to managed servers through SSH. You can either deposit the ssh users password for each server or authorize this public key on the target systems for PubKey Authentication (recommended for production):
servers.deleteConfirm: Really delete this server from the configuration?
servers.checkingSsh: Checking SSH Connection and config managability for {{server}} ...
servers.sshLoginDetail: Attemped to login through SSH to remote system
servers.confDirDetail: Configured directory must be writable for the management user
servers.groupMembershipDetail: The management user must be member of either 'bind' or 'named' group
servers.rndcDetail: Trying to execute '/usr/sbin/rndc status' to verify rndc function
servers.serverNameHelper: Short server alias, for internal use only.
servers.nsFqdnHelper: Fully qualified domain name of the dns server. Will be used for NS records.
servers.sshPassHelper: Leave blank to use pubkey authentication only.
servers.configPathHelper: Destination path for managed configuration. Must be writable for ssh user.
guide.intro: These are the recommended steps to prepare managed dns servers for configuration sync
guide.addUser: Add a new user on the dns server, which is a member of the bind group
guide.createDir: Create a directory for configuration files that is owned by the new user and the bind group and writable by both. You can freely choose the directory path, but keep in mind that SELinux or AppArmor may restrict you to use some subpath of the default config location.
guide.installKey: Install the ssh key to the users authorized_keys file. Use the SSH KEY INFO button to retrieve the key from DnsNM.
guide.addServer: Now you can add the server to the server manager.
guide.firewall: Make sure that the DnsNM host can connect to your managed DNS nodes and login through ssh. Consider firewall restrictions, tcpwrappers and user/group restrictions in sshd_config.
guide.includeFile: After the first configuration sync, include the deployed file (managedconfig.conf) in your main named.conf file.
